-1.title: Episode dated 24 August 2015
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Legendary actor Robert Duvall takes a look back at his career and discusses his new film "A Night In Old Mexico." Theresa Caputo, "The Long Island Medium" discusses her new book and newsmen/father and son duo Willie and Bill Geist talk about the conversations they never had.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Julia Roberts, Mark Ruffalo, Matt Bomer, Jim Parsons, Taylor Kitsch and Ryan Murphy talk about their new HBO movie "The Normal Heart." Jason Priestley talks about his iconic TV roles and Spike Lee discusses the lasting influence of his most significant films.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Jerome Bettis talks sports headlines, food expert Micael Pollan clarifies myths and realities in the current food world and super models Tyson Beckford and Marcus Schekenberg talk about achieving their perfect bodies.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Glenn Greenwald talks about his relationship with Edward Snowden, iconic DJ Steve Aoki clears up stereotypes in the EDM world and comedian Kumail Nanjiani talks about his hit HBO show "Silicon Valley."

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Don Johnson discusses his new film, 'Cold in July' and his acting career. Dancer Mark Ballas of 'Dancing With The Stars' talks about the show and is joined by special guest host and dance partner, Candace Cameron Bure.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Alan Alda discusses his acting career and as well as his work in education. Pop star Austin Mahone talks about his EP 'The Secret'. And actress Lacey Chabert discusses her new film, 'The Color of Rain'.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Shep Gordon discusses his new documentary and career as a manager to rock star legends. Celebrity blogger Necole Bitchie talks about her budding media empire. And The Naked Brothers Bands' Nate and Alex Wolff discuss their new music and upcoming film projects.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Lea Thompson and her co-stars discuss their film 'Ping Pong Summer'. Comedian Chris D'Elia talks about his new sitcom, 'Undateable'. And actress Busy Philips discusses motherhood and dishes on her famous TV roles.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: War Journalist Sebastian Junger discusses his new documentary, 'Korengal'. And The Bachelorette's Trista & Ryan Sutter dish on their new show, 'Marriage Boot Camp: Reality Stars'. And Teen Mom Farrah Abraham talks about her experiences in television and the adult film industry.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Joel and Victoria Osteen discuss their faith and upcoming event, America's Night of Hope. Josh Lucas talks about his new show, 'The Mysteries of Laura'.

11.title: Episode #1.11
11.plot: Maria Menounos discusses her new book, 'The EveryGirl's Guide To Diet and Fitness'. Filmmaker Eugene Jarecki talks about his new digital short, 'Just Say No... To The War On Drugs'. And Figure Skaters Meryl Davis and Charlie White talk about winning the gold medal at Sochi and competing against each other on 'Dancing With The Stars'.

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: Ice Cube and the directors of '22 Jump Street' talk about the upcoming film. Boomer Esiason discusses how he's raising awareness for cystic fibrosis research, and Brian McKnight talks about his new album, 'McKnight 360'.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Entertainment mogul Kris Jenner talks about the latest on 'Keeping Up with the Kardashians." Edie Windsor and lawyer Roberta Kaplan discuss life after DOMA. And Ripley's Believe It or Not archivist Edward Meyer show off some of the weird and wacky items from their collection.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: "Reading Rainbow" Host LeVar Burton joins us to discuss the importance of the iconic children's show. Actor Clark Gregg, known for his role as Agent Coulson in Marvel's "Agents of SHIELD," talks about his new comedy, "Trust Me." And La Toya Jackson discusses her show, "Life With La Toya."

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson talks about the latest in science news and tells us more about "Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey." Actress Andie MacDowell talks about her inspirational program "Stories of Strength," and Reddit Co-founder Alexis Ohanian discusses net neutrality.

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: NBA Star Jeremy Lin joins us to talk about basketball, life beyond 'Linsanity,' and his latest projects off the court with The Jeremy Lin Foundation. Musician and Producer Linda Perry discusses her new VH1 show 'Make or Break: The Linda Perry Project'. And Dog The Bounty Hunter talks about his CMT show 'Dog and Beth: On The Hunt'.

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: John Leguizamo talks about his new film 'Chef'. Pop Star Jesse McCartney discusses his new album 'In Technicolor'. And Gilbert Gottfried talks about his weekly series 'Gilbert Gottfried's Amazing Colossal Podcast'.

18.title: Episode #1.18
18.plot: The girl who swims with sharks, Madison Stewart, talks about her new documentary 'Shark Girl'. Mythbusters Adam Savage and Jamie Hyneman talk about their live show 'Mythbusters: Behind the Myths'. And Miss USA, Nia Sanchez, dishes on what it's really like to be a beauty queen.

19.title: Episode #1.19
19.plot: 'Breaking Bad' star Aaron and director Kat Candler discuss their new film, 'Hellion'. And New York Giants linebacker and cancer survivor Mark Herzlich talks about his new book, "What It Takes".

20.title: Episode #1.20
20.plot: Former Los Angeles Soccer star Cobi Jones joins us to discuss the 2014 FIFA World Cup. Filmmaker Brian Knappenberger also joins to talk about his new documentary, "The Internet's Own Boy". And former X-Factor contestant Bea Miller discusses her debut EP "Young Blood".

21.title: Episode #1.21
21.plot: Actress Jenny Slate and writer/director Gillian Robespierre talk about their controversial film 'Obvious Child'. Funnyman Marlon Wayans talks about his new TBS show 'Funniest Wins'. And actress/author Jenny Mollen discusses her new book of comedic essays 'I Like You Just The Way I Am'.

22.title: Episode #1.22
22.plot: Academy award-winning writer and director Paul Haggis discusses his new film 'Third Person'. 'Entourage' star Jerry Ferrara talks about his upcoming sequel 'Think Like A Man Too'. And Disney star Kelli Berglund talks about her show 'Lab Rats' as well as her new film 'How To Build a Better Boy'.

23.title: Episode #1.23
23.plot: Selenis Leyva and Yael Stone of 'Orange Is The New Black' join us to talk about season two of the popular series. "Kid President" Robby Novak fills us in on what's next for the YouTube sensation. We also hear from the Director and Cast of 'For Colored Boys,' who discuss the premise behind the dramatic web series.

24.title: Episode #1.24
24.plot: Actor Guy Pearce and writer/director David Michod talk about their new film "The Rover". Michael Kelly discusses his role on the hit show "House of Cards". Transgender violinist Tona Brown, also joins along with comedienne Tammy Peay, to discuss her career as a musical pioneer.

25.title: Episode #1.25
25.plot: "Boy Meets World" star Ben Savage gives us the scoop on the show's new spin-off "Girl Meets World." Magnolia Bakery's Chief Baking Officer Bobbie Lloyd dishes on judging the new season of "Next Great Baker." Actress Lea DeLaria talks about Gay Pride Month and the latest from "Orange Is The New Black."

26.title: Episode #1.26
26.plot: "Eat, Pray, Love" Author Elizabeth Gilbert discusses her new book "The Signature of All Things." Indianapolis Colts coach Chuck Pagano talks about his book "Sidelined." And Roger Ebert's wife Chaz Ebert, along with director Steve James, discuss the new documentary, "Life Itself."

27.title: Episode #1.27
27.plot: Original members of The Roots, Questlove and Black Thought , join us to discuss their new album and their current gig as the house band on "The Tonight Show." And Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Jo Becker joins us to talk about marriage equality and her new book "Forcing The Spring."

28.title: Episode #1.28
28.plot: Country music sensation Miranda Lambert talks about life on the road and her marriage to fellow country star Blake Shelton. We also discuss the launch of SnagFilms' new online comedy platform Thundershorts. And Historian and Combat veteran Andrew Bacevich discusses the escalating crisis in Iraq.

29.title: Episode #1.29
29.plot: Stars of "Orange Is The New Black" join us to discuss the second season of the popular Netflix show. Actor Rob Lowe discusses his latest role with Genworth's "Let's Talk" Tour. And Paul Wesley of "The Vampire Diaries" discusses the importance of Immigrant Heritage Month and the sixth season of his hit show.

30.title: Episode #1.30
30.plot: Award-winning comedy writer Joe Toplyn discusses his legendary career and new book "Comedy Writing For Late-Night TV." The Stars of "Land Ho!" talk about the film, aging, and friendship. Hip-Hop star Big Freedia talks about the second season of her hit show "Big Freedia: Queen of Bounce."

31.title: Episode #1.31
31.plot: Joan Rivers dishes on her new book, celebrity fashion and the latest gossip. Celebrity stylist Brad Goreski shares celebrity-inspired fashion tips and this summers hottest trends. Plus, author Elizabeth Mitchell talks about her new book "Liberty's Torch."

32.title: Episode #1.32
32.plot: Actor Larenz Tate discusses his career and latest projects. Nick Cannon talks about season six of MTV2's hit series "Wild 'N Out." And journalists Joshua Pribanic and Melissa Troutman discuss their fracking documentary "Triple Divide."

33.title: Episode #1.33
33.plot: Champion competitive eater Joey Chestnut talks about all things competitive eating. Talk show host and veteran Montel Williams discusses his activism for Veteran Affairs. And journalist Jason Riley discusses his new book and the debate around race and politics in America.

34.title: Episode #1.34
34.plot: Ms. New York Senior America Jane Rubinstein, talks about competing in beauty pageants after 60. Sideshow performer Todd Robbins eats glass and discusses the legacy of sideshow legend Ward Hall. And occupy activist Cecily McMillan talks about life after her 2012 arrest.

35.title: Episode #1.35
35.plot: Game Of Thrones actor Jason Momoa talks about his new movie "Road To Paloma." And award-winning actress Lee Grant discusses her career and new memoir "I Said Yes Everything."

36.title: Episode #1.36
36.plot: Hollywood icon Rob Reiner talks about his new film and legendary career. Also, celebrity chef Hugh Acheson discusses his brand new summer menu partnership.

37.title: Episode #1.37
37.plot: Actress and comedian Jane Lynch talks "Glee," the LGBT community, and conquering "Noseblindness." "Talk Stoop" host Cat Greenleaf discusses her love-hate relationship with smartphones. Actor Greg Poehler talks about his real life-based comedy series "Welcome to Sweden."

38.title: Episode #1.38
38.plot: "Boardwalk Empire" star Michael Pitt and actress Brit Marling talk about their new film "I Origin." Pop group Fifth Harmony dishes on their upcoming tour as well as their transition to stardom. Supermodel and U.N. Goodwill Ambassador Alex Wek discusses the displacement of 51 million refugees around the globe.

39.title: Episode #1.39
39.plot: Actor Liev Schreiber discusses the second season of the hit Showtime series "Ray Donovan." Director Richard Linklater and Actor Ellar Coltrane join HuffPost Live to talk about their film "Boyhood" and actress Rose McGowan discusses her directorial debut with her new short film "Dawn."

40.title: Episode #1.40
40.plot: Comedian David Rees talks about his new NatGeo series "Going Deep." Legendary astronaut Buzz Aldrin looks ahead at the future of space exploration and "The Hot Wives of Orlando" stars, Tymberlee Hill and Andrea Savage, dish on their new parody series on Hulu.

41.title: Episode #1.41
41.plot: Academy Award-winning actress Anna Paquin discusses her career and the final season of "True Blood," while Teyonah Parris of "Mad Men" talks about her roles in three upcoming films.

imdb.plot outline: HuffPost Live Conversations is a programming block that airs daily on MGM's diginet, The Works. HuffPost Live Conversations launched on May 26, 2014 and airs 4 hours a day with segments from HuffPost Live, The Huffington Post's live-streaming network. The programming is formatted into a 2-hour block that airs twice a day, featuring an eclectic mix of content ranging from politics to entertainment to international news and more.
imdb.title: HuffPost Live Conversations
plot: _HuffPost Live Conversations_ (qv) is a programming block that airs daily on MGM's diginet, The Works. _HuffPost Live Conversations_ (qv) launched on May 26, 2014 and airs 4 hours a day with segments from HuffPost Live, The Huffington Post's live-streaming network. The programming is formatted into a 2-hour block that airs twice a day, featuring an eclectic mix of content ranging from politics to entertainment to international news and more.::Anonymous
